ws2d.init

Class Config

  • java.lang.Object
    • ws2d.init.Config

  • public final class Config
extends java.lang.Object
    The configuration class for Ws2D.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Config(stg.json.JsonObject data)
      Constructs a new instance of Config with an optional JsonObject that can override default settings.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getHeartbeatInterval()
      Returns the heartbeat interval of the server.
      int getHttpPort()
      Returns the HTTP server port.
      int getMaxClients()
      Returns the maximum number of clients the server can support.
      int getTps()
      Returns the desired ticks per second (TPS) of the server.
      void setHeartbeatInterval(int heartbeatInterval)
      Sets the server heartbeat interval to the specified value.
      void setHttpPort(int httpPort)
      Sets the server HTTP port to the specified value.
      void setMaxClients(int maxClients)
      Sets the server max clients to the specified value.
      void setTps(int tps)
      Sets the server ticks per second (TPS) to the specified value.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Config

        public Config(stg.json.JsonObject data)
        Constructs a new instance of Config with an optional JsonObject that can override default settings.
        Parameters:
        data - the optional JSON settings.

    • Method Detail

      • getHttpPort

        public int getHttpPort()
        Returns the HTTP server port.
        Returns:
        the HTTP server port.

      • setHttpPort

        public void setHttpPort(int httpPort)
        Sets the server HTTP port to the specified value. If this value does not satisfy the condition 0 < port < 65536 no action is taken. It is also important to note that this function has no effect on the used port if it is called after the server starts.
        Parameters:
        httpPort - the new HTTP port.

      • getTps

        public int getTps()
        Returns the desired ticks per second (TPS) of the server.
        Returns:
        the desired TPS of the server.

      • setTps

        public void setTps(int tps)
        Sets the server ticks per second (TPS) to the specified value. If this value does not satisfy the condition 0 < tps < 951 no action is taken. It is also important to note that this function has no effect on the TPS of the game loop if it is called after the server starts.
        Parameters:
        tps - the new TPS.

      • getMaxClients

        public int getMaxClients()
        Returns the maximum number of clients the server can support.
        Returns:
        the maximum number of clients the server can support.

      • setMaxClients

        public void setMaxClients(int maxClients)
        Sets the server max clients to the specified value. If this value does not satisfy the condition 0 < maxClients no action is taken. It is also important to note that this function has no effect on the effective maximum number of clients if it is called after the server starts.
        Parameters:
        maxClients - the new maximum number of clients.

      • getHeartbeatInterval

        public int getHeartbeatInterval()
        Returns the heartbeat interval of the server. This is how often a packet is emitted to check a client's connection.
        Returns:
        the heartbeat interval of the server.

      • setHeartbeatInterval

        public void setHeartbeatInterval(int heartbeatInterval)
        Sets the server heartbeat interval to the specified value. If this value does not satisfy the condition 9 < interval no action is taken. It is also important to note that this function has no effect on the effective heartbeat interval if it is called after the server starts.
        Parameters:
        heartbeatInterval - the new heartbeat interval.
